results.title: Australian diary. No. 005
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine features the following items: swimming instruction classes in New South Wales; problems with traffic in Melbourne; First Nations people show their skill with the stockwhip; Sulman architectural awards and strange animals at the Melbourne Zoo.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 026
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a play centre/nursery school opens in Canberra; Norris E. Dodd, United Nations Director of Food, outlines the world food position; overseas telecommunications are featured and a closer look at Broken Hill is shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 071
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: ant hills in the north of the continent are a natural mystery; aa flying padre ministers to a congregation spread over a vast area; Fulbright scholars extend their knowledge of Australia and the art of making a humble broom is shown.

results.title: The Helping hand
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Visatone (Australia)
results.brief_description: Three new-Australians tell of the moment when they felt accepted in Australia and how they have worked to fit in with the local way of living. English lessons at Cooma are shown and finally a naturalization ceremony in a Sydney suburb.
results.description: Three new-Australians tell of the moment when they felt accepted in Australia and how they have worked to fit in with the local way of living. English lessons at Cooma are shown and finally a naturalization ceremony in a Sydney suburb.

results.title: A Mountain's domain
results.creator_credit: Robert Walker, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description: The mountain is Mount Warning in the north-eastern part of New South Wales. Its domain is the warm, colorful scenery of the Tweed and Byron Rivers and Gold Coast region. This tourist film is packed with landscape, but it also dwells upon the people of the north-east who are as important to the region as its climate and natural beauty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Walker, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates

results.title: Taxation office
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The workings of the Taxation Department, as explained to a young man joining the department. This film serves as an introduction to new Taxation Department staff, and gives the man in the street an insight as to how the Department functions.

results.title: One good reason
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Roland Beckett and Film Australia

results.title: Out of Control
results.brief_description: Developed in co-operation with the Child and Adolescent Psychiatry Unit of the Prince of Wales Hospital, this video shows how to offer support to young children between the ages of 10-14 years, to say “No” to drugs that may be offered to them. It is suitable for use by parents, community organisations, church groups, counsellors and teachers.
